detaileddescription.para: This structure stores compressed data. It is typically exported by demuxers and then passed as input to decoders, or received as output from encoders and then passed to muxers.

For video, it should typically contain one compressed frame. For audio it may contain several compressed frames. Encoders are allowed to output empty packets, with no compressed data, containing only side data (e.g. to update some stream parameters at the end of encoding).

The semantics of data ownership depends on the buf field. If it is set, the packet data is dynamically allocated and is valid indefinitely until a call to av_packet_unref() reduces the reference count to 0.
If the buf field is not set av_packet_ref() would make a copy instead of increasing the reference count.
The side data is always allocated with av_malloc(), copied by av_packet_ref() and freed by av_packet_unref().

sizeof(AVPacket) being a part of the public ABI is deprecated. once av_init_packet() is removed, new packets will only be able to be allocated with av_packet_alloc(), and new fields may be added to the end of the struct with a minor bump.
Allocate an AVPacket and set its fields to default values. The resulting struct must be freed using av_packet_free().

simplesect.para: An AVPacket filled with default values or NULL on failure.
this only allocates the AVPacket itself, not the data buffers. Those must be allocated through other means such as av_new_packet.

detaileddescription.para: Create a new packet that references the same data as src.
This is a shortcut for av_packet_alloc()+av_packet_ref().

simplesect.para: newly created AVPacket on success, NULL on error.

detaileddescription.para: Free the packet, if the packet is reference counted, it will be unreferenced first.

parameterdescription.para: packet to be freed. The pointer will be set to NULL.

detaileddescription.para: Allocate the payload of a packet and initialize its fields with default values.
Reduce packet size, correctly zeroing padding
Increase packet size, correctly zeroing padding

parameterdescription.para: number of bytes by which to increase the size of the packet

detaileddescription.para: Initialize a reference-counted packet from av_malloc()ed data.

parameterdescription.para: packet to be initialized. This function will set the data, size, and buf fields, all others are left untouched.
Data allocated by av_malloc() to be used as packet data. If this function returns successfully, the data is owned by the underlying AVBuffer. The caller may not access the data through other means.
size of data in bytes, without the padding. I.e. the full buffer size is assumed to be size + AV_INPUT_BUFFER_PADDING_SIZE.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, a negative AVERROR on error

detaileddescription.para: Allocate new information of a packet.

simplesect.para: pointer to fresh allocated data or NULL otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (AVPacket *pkt, enum AVPacketSideDataType type, uint8_t *data, size_t size)
memberdef.name: av_packet_add_side_data

detaileddescription.para: Wrap an existing array as a packet side data.

parameterdescription.para: the side data array. It must be allocated with the av_malloc() family of functions. The ownership of the data is transferred to pkt.

simplesect.para: a non-negative number on success, a negative AVERROR code on failure. On failure, the packet is unchanged and the data remains owned by the caller.

detaileddescription.para: Shrink the already allocated side data buffer
Get side information from packet.

parameterdescription.para: If supplied, *size will be set to the size of the side data or to zero if the desired side data is not present.

simplesect.para: pointer to data if present or NULL otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Pack a dictionary for use in side_data.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to store the size of the returned data

simplesect.para: pointer to data if successful, NULL otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Unpack a dictionary from side_data.
Convenience function to free all the side data stored. All the other fields stay untouched.
Setup a new reference to the data described by a given packet
If src is reference-counted, setup dst as a new reference to the buffer in src. Otherwise allocate a new buffer in dst and copy the data from src into it.
All the other fields are copied from src.

parameterdescription.para: Destination packet. Will be completely overwritten.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, a negative AVERROR on error. On error, dst will be blank (as if returned by av_packet_alloc()).

detaileddescription.para: Wipe the packet.
Unreference the buffer referenced by the packet and reset the remaining packet fields to their default values.
Move every field in src to dst and reset src.
Copy only "properties" fields from src to dst.
Properties for the purpose of this function are all the fields beside those related to the packet data (buf, data, size)
Ensure the data described by a given packet is reference counted.

simplesect.para: This function does not ensure that the reference will be writable. Use av_packet_make_writable instead for that purpose.

parameterdescription.para: packet whose data should be made reference counted.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, a negative AVERROR on error. On failure, the packet is unchanged.

detaileddescription.para: Create a writable reference for the data described by a given packet, avoiding data copy if possible.

parameterdescription.para: Packet whose data should be made writable.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, a negative AVERROR on failure. On failure, the packet is unchanged.

detaileddescription.para: Convert valid timing fields (timestamps / durations) in a packet from one timebase to another. Timestamps with unknown values (AV_NOPTS_VALUE) will be ignored.

parameterdescription.para: packet on which the conversion will be performed
source timebase, in which the timing fields in pkt are expressed
destination timebase, to which the timing fields will be converted

detaileddescription.para: Allocate an AVContainerFifo instance for AVPacket.
Flag is used to discard packets which are required to maintain valid decoder state but are not required for output and should be dropped after decoding.
The packet comes from a trusted source.
Otherwise-unsafe constructs such as arbitrary pointers to data outside the packet may be followed.
Flag is used to indicate packets that contain frames that can be discarded by the decoder. I.e. Non-reference frames.
Types and functions for working with AVPacket.
